entry.title: Monotron (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a heavily modified Monotron synthesizer (PCB pictured) was nicknamed "FrankenSynth" by music resource site Ask.Audio?

entry.title: 1834 Philadelphia race riot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1834 Philadelphia race riot began at a carousel before spreading to other parts of the city?

entry.title: Midsommar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the May Queen dress worn by Florence Pugh in the film Midsommar was made of 10,000 silk flowers and reportedly sold for US$65,000 at auction?

entry.title: William J. McGee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that William J. McGee said that the 2022 Southwest Airlines flight delays were the result of "appearing to regulate rather than actually regulating"?

entry.title: 1830 Liverpool by-election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the contest of the 1830 Liverpool by-election was considered to be "in great measure a personal one"?

entry.title: Berta Berkovich (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Berta Berkovich, who was skilled in sewing, managed to survive Auschwitz in a fashion salon established by the wife of the concentration camp commandant?

entry.title: 1931 Valentine earthquake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1931 Valentine earthquake was the strongest earthquake in recorded history to hit Texas?

entry.title: cyclists in Turkey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kangal can be a hazard to cyclists in Turkey?
